result.execSummary:
The defendant James Slattery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1150.00 paid to Kristie S.

Pay all mandatory court costs fees and surcharges be paid from bail on deposit, balance paid in monthly payments of $100.00 the 15th of every month until paid. Failure to pay will result in the loss of Huber privileges, and a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

Huber privileges for work, FORTHWITH
*****ORDER;  June 20, 2014/Judge Lindsey Grady: Because defendant is an Illinois resident and now works for the State of Illinois, his Huber privileges shall be amended to allow him to travel outside of Wisdonsin for the purposes of work, or in the alternative, his sentence transferred to Illinois, if approved by HOC superintendent.*****

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed & Distributed, Order: Defendant's Huber privileges shall be amended to allow him to travel outside of Wisconsin for the purposes of work or, in the alternative, his sentence can be transfered to Illinois, if approved by HOC Superintendent.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Lindsey Grady, Br. 23, for review. jbs

James Slattery's Postconviction Motion For Sentence Modification To allow Him To Cross Over The Border To Work Or, In The Alternative, To Have His Huber Transferred To Illinois - Filed by Attorney Jason D. Baltz
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant James Slattery in court with attorney Jason D Baltz.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court received & reviewed the victim impact/restitution statement / letter.  Victim addressed court as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 4 DAYS time served, with good time, with Huber privileges for work, FORTHWITH. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,150.00 paid to Kristie S. plus all mandatory court costs fees and surcharges be paid from bail on deposit, balance paid in monthly payments of $100.00 the 15th of every month until paid. Failure to pay will result in the loss of Huber privileges, and a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

ADDRESS INFO for James Slattery
Current: 214 Homestead Road #2, La Grange Park, IL 60526 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2014)
Prior: 3540 County Road H #5, Franksville, WI 53126

Defendant James Slattery in court with attorney Jason D Baltz.  Michael C Schindhelm for Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling. Defendant appearing in court, court VACATED the stayed bench warrant. Discussion regarding the calendaring error. Discussion as to global offer from the state regarding a matter in Racine County. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding global offer. Plea Hearing proceeded.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Slattery and attorney Jason D Baltz NOT IN COURT.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State and Defense counsel have matter set for Scheduling Conference on 4/18/2014 at 1:30 pm. Court STAYED a bench warrant to maintain jurisdiction and set matter over to Scheduling Conference on 4/18/2014 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant James Slattery in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
$1000.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter). Court ordered no possession or use no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kristie S.

Defendant James Slattery in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz. Zach Whittow under the student practice rule supervised by Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defense counsel enters a not guilty plea to count 2 on behalf of the defendant.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
$1500 cash bail posted. Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/10/14 at 1:30pm.
